summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to French authorities for assistance in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It seeks to interview a French citizen witness who was allegedly sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein after meeting him and Maxwell, and to obtain records from French law enforcement and Epstein's Paris residence. The document outlines the charges against Maxwell and the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, transportation of minors, and coercion/enticement for her role in assisting Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1994 through 2005. Indicted in July 2019, arrested, and died by suicide in August 2019.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with, assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's sexual abuse of minors by recruiting, grooming, and enticing victims.
The document states Maxwell invited the witness to New York, which resulted in the witness being sexually abused by Epstein. Maxwell is also a subject of the investigation regarding this witness.
The witness was allegedly sexually abused by Epstein in New York after meeting him and Maxwell.

events.title: Witness meets Epstein and Maxwell
events.description: The French citizen witness, then a minor, met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Period of alleged conspiracy and abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Epstein to entice and cause minor victims to travel to New York to be groomed and subjected to sexual abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein arrested
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to a grand jury indictment charging him with conspiracy to sexually traffic in minors.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his jail cell in New York.

events.title: Maxwell indicted
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Maxwell arrested
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained pending trial.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell trial date
events.description: A trial date of July 12, 2020, had been set for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (as of the time of this request).

events.title: Search of Epstein's Paris residence
events.description: French authorities searched Jeffrey Epstein's residence in the Paris 16th district.

locations: Maison-Laffitte, France (Ghislaine Maxwell's place of birth)
keyFacts: The U.S. is seeking to interview a French citizen witness who was allegedly sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein in New York after being introduced to him and Ghislaine Maxwell in approximately 1996.
The U.S. authorities believe this witness may be critical to the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell and could be the subject of additional charges against her.

The request seeks records from French law enforcement, including prior interview notes of the witness and materials seized from Epstein's Paris residence in September 2019, such as photographs and documents relating to Maxwell.
The document emphasizes the need for strict confidentiality to prevent witness tampering, evidence destruction, or compromising the trial.

The charges against Maxwell include conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), transportation of minors with intent to engage in criminal sexual activity (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), and coercion and enticement (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), relating to conduct from at least 1994 to 1997.
